metadata.titel_preek: The Line between Good and Evil

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the territory of Sin and Death to disarm the rebel human and justify the sinner through the substitutionary work of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: It is the Lord Jesus Christ who disarms us.
God's power is able to make right all that has happened in the past.
He has gone into the Day of Judgment utterly alone... taking the sentence of condemnation upon himself.
we will be set right by the power of God
all who have suffered as a result of our faults will have perfect restitution

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Word of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the might of the God in whom Abraham believed
the power of the Word of God which spoke, and it was so
it will be reckoned to us who believe
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in bondage).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Armor of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Put on the whole armor of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Help.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that invades and sustains.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Devil (The Powers)
tekstueel_bewijs: principalities, against the powers, against the world rulers of this present darkness
the power of the forces holding him in thrall
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'law' and a 'power' that renders the human will incompetent (Romans 7).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of laying down arms and acknowledging the 'line' within.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God's invasion) enables the secondary program (human disarming).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God's power is able to make right...
It is the Lord Jesus Christ who disarms us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I do not do what I want...
We think we can make sin go away...
He did not see that there was anything he needed to do differently.

voorbeelden: he is a rebel who must lay down his arms
when I want to do right, evil lies close at hand
Jesus wants us to know ahead of time
This power is able to do things that we can only dream about

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of 'Pouvoir' (Power) and God's sovereign endowment of it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Denial (~S1) to Solidarity in Sin (~S2), then through the Judgment (S2) borne by Christ to Justification (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ enters S2 (Judgment) alone to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; judgment is 'decreed' and 'good news' because it is real.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human as a 'rebel' in bondage rather than a 'student' needing a moral lesson.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: George Washington and Abraham Lincoln both called America to repentance.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has gone into the Day of Judgment utterly alone... bearing it away from us.
The powers we face are untiring, malevolent, and extremely clever.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lincoln is used as a theological model, but specifically for his recognition of human limitation and divine judgment, not as a moral hero to be mimicked by human effort.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Abraham (as one who believed in the God who raises the dead)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: Abraham is not the hero; the God who justifies is the hero.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the collapse of self-justification (disarming).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'line through the heart' (Hamartology) to the 'invasion from on high' (Soteriology) is seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: taking the sentence of condemnation upon himself... The landing troops have arrived.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of 'Pouvoir' (Power) to the paralyzed/addicted subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; sin is a 'thrall' that even 'men of their word' cannot break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The human is correctly positioned as the Receiver of an action they cannot perform.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on 'cannot' (Romans 7) is essential for the 'invasion' metaphor to work.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God justifies) → Ethics (Man lays down arms).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism. It uses political and historical examples not to exhort the will, but to expose the 'line' that necessitates a Divine Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the Lincoln anecdotes; Greimas shows these anecdotes serve to establish the 'Opponent' as internal and cosmic.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 3; Greimas shows how the sermon makes the hearer a functional actant within the Romans 3 narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'invasion' metaphor as the primary engine that switches the Subject from the 'struggling human' to the 'victorious Christ'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Subject-Switch' perfectly at the climax.
